DOC.detailed_description: This study propose : ( 1 ) determine injection BTX-A hamstring muscle result measurable physiologic ( body structure body function ) change observe normal saline injection , child spastic diplegic CP walk flexed-knee gait pattern ; ( 2 ) ass whether physiologic change translate functional ( activity participation ) improvement ; ( 3 ) evaluate family 's perception change function , activity , participation , quality life . This study demonstrate BTX-A injected overactive hamstring muscle child spastic cerebral palsy ( CP ) flexed-knee walk pattern measurable effect across spectrum dimension disablement International Classification Functioning , Disability , Health ( ICF ) . It multi-center , prospective , randomize , double-blind trial compare result injection BTX- A placebo saline control , overactive hamstring muscle , use multiple outcome measure . Temporal-spatial gait parameter , instrument 3DGA kinematics , passive ROM , spasticity measurement Ashworth Tardieu scale , muscle strength/control , Gross Motor Function Measurement ( GMFM ) , Pediatric Outcomes Data Collection Instrument ( PODCI ) , Gillette Functional Assessment Questionnaire ( FAQ ) , 6-Minute Walk Test , Goal Attainment Scale ( GAS ) , assess ICF domain , collect baseline 1 month , 3 month , 6 month post-injection . Power analysis demonstrates need randomize 250 child ( 125 BTX-A , 125 saline ) , allow attrition . Nine participate hospital contribute patient .
